oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Young woman in white hat
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brazelton
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Photographers
African American women; Portrait photographs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A number of formal portrait photographs of African American subjects were made by Brazelton Studio, Chattanooga. The 1928 City Directory shows Brazelton Photo Studio to have been located in the heart of the African American business district, on 9th Street between Lindsey and Houston.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Young woman in white hat, African American Photography Collection, MS.2129. University of Tennessee, Knoxville - Libraries
